title: JSE Ends Week on a Positive Note
text:
PSG Wealth Daily Investment Update, 16 September 2019

The JSE ended the week flat, but in the green, as markets digested the European Central Bank’s (ECB) decision to cut interest rates after it pledged to boost economic activity. Shortly after the closing bell, the All Share was up by 0.06%.Notwithstanding losses from technology stocks, US markets traded higher on Friday after Washington backtracked tariff hikes on Chinese goods, easing trade tensions. The was up by 0.20% shortly after the JSE closed.European shares surged on Friday after the ECB decided to boost economic activity on the back of cooling trade tensions. Shortly after the JSE closed, the was up 0.31%, 40 rose to 0.22% and 30 ended 0.47% in the green.Hong Kong stocks ended slightly lower on Friday after reports of progress in US-China trade talks. The closed 0.10% in the red.Signs of easing trade tensions and cheers over the ECB’s decision to launch a new stimulus programme lifted the to a four-month high on Friday. The Nikkei Index closed 1.05% in the green.The rand strengthened against the dollar on Friday afternoon as investors sought higher-yielding investments after the ECB trimmed interest rates. Just after the JSE closed, the rand weakened to R14.55/$.More risk appetite from the ECB’s economic stimulus programme pushed the price of gold lower on Friday, while palladium retreated from a record high seen in the previous session. At 19h00, an ounce of traded at $1 489.50.Oil prices declined on Friday on the back of growing concerns over the state of the global economy and its growth trajectory. At 19h00 a barrel of lost 0.20% and traded at $60.57.
